Paragraph: Uzbekistan is a doubly landlocked country in Central Asia. It is a unitary state with a presidential constitutional republic. Formally known as the Republic of Uzbekistan, the country is a secular state. It is bordered by five landlocked countries: Kazakhstan to the north; Kyrgyzstan to the northeast; Tajikistan to the southeast; Afghanistan to the south; and Turkmenistan to the southwest. Uzbekistan also shares a short border with a sixth country, Kyrgyzstan, to the northwest.
